title: War Powers Law Does Not Apply to Trump’s Boat Strikes, Administration Says
summary: The move deepened the idea that a Vietnam-era law, which says congressionally unauthorized deployments into “hostilities” must end after 60 days, does not apply to airstrike campaigns.

title: Trump’s Team Offers to Keep Some Ballroom Donors Incognito
summary: Many corporate interests that have donated to the president’s pet project have business before his administration.

title: Trump Threatens Military Action in Nigeria Over Protections for Christians
summary: Accusing Nigeria of not doing enough to protect Christians from violence, President Trump said he had ordered the Pentagon to prepare for action.

title: Trump Administration Must Make Food Stamp Payments Within Days, Judge Says
summary: The written order came one day after a court told the Trump administration it must pay benefits in the program known as SNAP during the shutdown.

title: NYC, Long a City of Contradictions, Is Still Turning Up New Ones
summary: New York City has often set the political, cultural and financial course of the country. Tuesday’s mayoral election — and a New Yorker watching from Washington — could scramble it all.

title: In Chinese American Families, There’s a Generational Split on Mamdani
summary: Many older Chinese immigrants are shifting to the political right, dividing from their children, a trend playing out in the New York City mayor’s race.

title: NJ Governor’s Race Draws Obama and Hannity but Not Trump in Final Days
summary: The former president held a rally for Mikie Sherrill, the Democrat running for governor of New Jersey. Prominent leaders have also campaigned with her Republican opponent, Jack Ciattarelli.

title: California Promised Insurance Relief, But Delivered Loopholes
summary: New regulations were supposed to ensure that homeowners in fire zones would have coverage available. But companies can still avoid serving many high-risk areas, a Times investigation found.

title: Women Need Workplace Boundaries — Not Remote Work or Flexibility
summary: Discussion of women in the workplace often focuses on flexible hours, but what’s actually needed is shift work — pioneered by the medical profession.

title: How Liberalism Wins
summary: Democrats do not just need to win more people. They also need to win more places.

title: 2 Arrested After Stabbing on Train Near Cambridge, England
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain denounced the attack, which the police said left nine victims with “life-threatening injuries.”

title: Death Toll Rises From Hurricane Melissa as Many Communities Remain Cut off
summary: Authorities have yet to reach dozens of communities in Jamaica, raising the question of how many people really died in last week’s storm.

title: An Outlier in Irish Politics Has Become the Country’s President
summary: Propelled by anti-establishment fervor, Catherine Connolly was elected last week with a landmark popular mandate.

title: Explosion at Harvard Medical School Was ‘Intentional,’ Officials Say
summary: Two people were seen running from the building afterward, the school said. No injuries were reported, the school police said.
